definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
Humble Administrator's Garden in Suzhou, Jiangsu
my unworthy manuscript (humble expr.)/my humble writing
see 弄巧成拙[nong4 qiao3 cheng2 zhuo1]
my unworthy writing (humble expr.)/my worthless manuscript
my clumsy writing (humble expr.)/my humble pen
lit. clumsy mouth and broken tongue (idiom); awkward speaker

sentences.english: Let not the sword-knife mock its hperdle for being dull.
sentences.chinese: 不要让刀锋嘲讽它柄子的拙钝。

sentences.english: Let not the sword-blade mock its handle for being blunt.
sentences.chinese: 不要让剑刃讥笑剑柄的钝拙。

sentences.english: The workmanship of this furniture is very poor.
Its long and once sharp beak becomes bent.
sentences.chinese: 其一度锋利的长喙已变得钝拙弯曲。

sentences.english: Her original email of request, the original poem, and my calligraphy are all attached.
sentences.chinese: 她的请求原件电邮及原诗和拙之翰墨一并附呈。

sentences.english: Thanks to Disciple Chang Wang for arranging my calligraphy of the Hundred-Syllable Mantra into a mantra wheel for practice.
sentences.chinese: 感谢弟子昌旺将拙书的百字明咒作成供实修用的咒轮。

sentences.english: Using nuclear weapons would be stupid: anyone can't take over the country towards the very least.
sentences.chinese: 操做核兵器将是鸠拙的，由于何等您没有能收受他。

sentences.english: Joe, a clumsy and timid horseman, did not look to advantage in the saddle.
sentences.chinese: 乔胆子小，骑术又拙，骑在鞍子上老不象样。

sentences.english: Such stupidity is without equal in the whole history of human relines.
sentences.chinese: 如此鸠拙的行为在整个人际相干史上找不出第二个。

definition: vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
strong/vigorous/robust/to draw near/to come to an end
